summary: This document is T-Mobile USA's response to a federal subpoena (dated February 16, 2007) for subscriber information and call detail records for a specific mobile number. It includes account details for a subscriber in Miami Beach, FL, and extensive call logs from December 2003 through March 2004, showing numerous calls to/from Miami, FL, and other locations. This document is a detailed itemized phone bill for a T-Mobile account, covering call and messaging activity from February 21, 2004, to March 28, 2004. The bill shows a high volume of calls and texts, primarily to/from Miami, FL, with some activity to New York, Oakland, CA, and Poland. It is a financial record likely subpoenaed to establish communication patterns. This document is a detailed itemized telephone bill for an account, covering the period from March 28, 2004, to April 19, 2004. It lists numerous calls and text messages, primarily between Miami, FL, and New York, NY, with some international calls to locations like Manta and Poland. The document is significant as it provides a record of communication patterns and potential contacts during a key period in the Epstein case. This document is a series of itemized mobile phone billing statements, showing detailed messaging and call records for an account from late March to early May 2004. The records show frequent communication between Miami, FL, New York, NY, and international locations like Poland and South Africa, with a high volume of text messages and calls. This document is a detailed telephone billing statement for an account, covering calls and text messages from April to May 2004. It shows a high volume of communication between locations associated with Jeffrey Epstein, including Miami, New York City, Denver, and Las Vegas. The record is significant as it provides a log of communication patterns and travel during a period relevant to the investigation. This document is a T-Mobile phone bill itemizing call and messaging activity for an account from May 15, 2004, to June 19, 2004. It shows frequent calls and texts between locations including Miami, FL; New York, NY; and international calls to Poland. The bill details airtime, messaging charges, and service fees, providing a record of communication patterns during this period. This document is a T-Mobile phone bill detailing itemized call and text message records for an account from June 20, 2004, to August 10, 2004. It shows frequent communication between Miami, FL, and New York, NY, with numerous incoming and outgoing calls and texts, but no specific individuals are named. This document is a series of itemized cellular phone billing statements from August 2004, detailing call logs with destinations including Miami, FL; New York, NY; and other locations. It shows frequent mobile-to-mobile calls, suggesting communication patterns relevant to the investigation.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: A federal subpoena pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 876 was issued, requesting customer information and call records from T-Mobile USA.

events.title: T-Mobile Subpoena Response
events.description: T-Mobile USA's Law Enforcement Relations department formally responds to the subpoena, providing account details and call logs.

events.title: Phone and Messaging Activity Period
events.description: A detailed log of hundreds of incoming/outgoing calls and text messages from a specific mobile phone account, showing frequent communication primarily in the Miami area and some international texts to Poland.

events.title: Communication Activity Begins
events.description: The detailed call and messaging log begins, showing numerous calls and texts from Miami, FL.

events.title: High Volume Communication Day
events.description: A day with numerous incoming and outgoing calls to/from Miami, FL, and other locations like New York and Las Vegas.

events.title: Billing Statement Date
events.description: The date the itemized billing statement was generated, summarizing charges for the period.

events.title: August 2004 Phone Activity
events.description: A detailed log of incoming and outgoing cellular phone calls, primarily between Miami, FL and New York, NY, with numerous mobile-to-mobile calls.

locations: Parsippany, NJ 07054 (T-Mobile Law Enforcement Relations office)
Pernito, FL (Call destination - likely typo for another FL location)
keyFacts: A federal subpoena was served on T-Mobile USA on March 23, 2007, for records related to a specific mobile number.
The subscriber account was established on March 12, 2003, and was cancelled on December 21, 2005.
The call detail records cover a period from December 2003 to March 2004, showing high call volume to and from Miami, FL, and other Florida locations.
International text messages were sent to Poland on multiple dates.
The subscriber's personal information, including address in Miami Beach, FL, and service plan details, were disclosed.
The phone bill covers a period from February 21, 2004, to March 28, 2004, showing extensive communication activity.
The vast majority of calls and texts are to/from Miami, FL, indicating the account holder's primary location or network was in that area during this period.
There are multiple text messages sent to Poland, suggesting an international contact or contact traveling internationally.
The bill includes calls to/from other U.S. locations like New York, NY; Oakland, CA; and Hackensack, NJ, indicating a network of contacts in those cities.
The document is a financial record (phone bill) that would be used to trace communication patterns and establish timelines, but it contains no named individuals.
The document is a detailed telephone bill spanning from March 28, 2004, to April 19, 2004.
Communication patterns show frequent calls between Miami, FL, and New York, NY, with numerous incoming and outgoing calls.
International calls and text messages were made to locations including Manta, Poland, and Grand Cayman.
The bill includes both voice calls and text messaging charges, with detailed timestamps and durations.
No specific named individuals are identified in this document chunk; it contains only location and call data.
The document is a detailed mobile phone billing record spanning from approximately March 30, 2004, to May 3, 2004.
It shows an extremely high volume of text message and call activity, with hundreds of entries, primarily between Miami, FL, and New York, NY.
International communications are recorded to and from Poland and South Africa during this period.
The records are itemized by date, time, destination, message/call type, direction (incoming/outgoing), and cost, with each text message typically charged $0.05.
The document is part of the Epstein case files, suggesting it is a financial record subpoenaed as evidence, likely pertaining to the communication patterns of a key individual or associate.
The document is a detailed telephone bill covering April and May 2004, showing extensive communication activity.
The primary locations for calls and texts are Miami, FL, and New York, NY, with secondary hubs in Denver, CO, and Las Vegas, NV.
The log includes both voice calls and text messages, with a very high frequency of communication, often involving mobile-to-mobile calls.
The billing statement date is May 22, 2004, indicating this is a record of communications from the preceding weeks.
No specific individuals are named in this extracted chunk; the data consists solely of call destinations, times, and charges.
The phone bill covers a period from May 15, 2004, to June 19, 2004, showing detailed communication records.
Frequent calls and text messages are logged between Miami, FL, and New York, NY, indicating regular communication between these locations.
International calls/texts to Poland are recorded on specific dates (e.g., May 17, May 26, June 10), suggesting international contacts.
The bill includes numerous 'Mobile-to-Mobile' calls (denoted as type F), indicating calls between devices on the same network.
The document is a financial record (phone bill) that could be used to establish communication patterns and locations of the account holder during this timeframe.
The document is a detailed phone bill covering approximately 7 weeks from June 20 to August 10, 2004.
Communication patterns show high frequency between Miami, FL, and New York, NY, with hundreds of calls and texts logged.
The account includes services like 'Family Time', 'Text Message 1000', and 'T-Mobile to T-Mobile' minutes.
No personal names or identifiers are present in the provided text, only locations and call details.
The bill includes charges for airtime, messaging, taxes, and one-time equipment fees, totaling $36.48 for one period and $9.52 for another.
The document is a T-Mobile phone bill covering August 2004, showing detailed call logs.
Call destinations are heavily concentrated in Miami, FL and New York, NY, with some calls to Silver Spring, MD.
A high volume of calls are marked as mobile-to-mobile (type 'F'), indicating frequent communication between cell phones.
The bill shows a pattern of frequent incoming and outgoing calls throughout the day during this period.
The document is labeled as part of the Epstein case files (EFTA00007301.pdf, EFTA00007397-EFTA00007400).
